intro: Astragalus karasarensis, commonly known as Karasarens wild pea, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to the arid regions of Central Asia, particularly found in Kazakhstan and parts of Russia. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, compound leaves, and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, semi-desert environments. Astragalus karasarensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various herbivores.
